alert.note: Alert for Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 13 at 2:02PM MST until March 16 at 10:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Flagstaff AZ has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Arizona... Oak Creek near Cornville affecting Yavapai County Valleys and Basins zone. For the Oak Creek...including Sedona, Cornville...flooding is possible due to enhanced snowmelt from runoff and rain beginning late Tuesday evening, continuing through Thursday morning. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Oak Creek near Cornville. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, flooding begins to inundate lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 8.0 feet, flooding of lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 9.0 feet, hiking trails along banks of creek affected. Portions of residential yards flooded. At 12.0 feet, significant flooding of RV park near Page Springs Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM MST Monday the stage was 5.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Wednesday afternoon with a peak river stage of 11.3 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Oak Creek Cornville 8.0 5.1 Mon 1 pm MST 5.7 7.1 6.9 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz The next statement will be issued by Tuesday at 200 PM MST.
